intro: Psychotria blepharophylla, commonly known as the "veined psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
